Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Cup
Description: Large flaring cup with a ring base and a thick lip. The clay is typical of Upper Egypt: a pink calcareous clay that turns white inside when baked. The vessel was well fashioned and the throwing marks are erased.
